stories.title: How men live without working in America

stories.text:
First year of high school.

My boy has attracted the attention of the class bully who is 18 months older and bigger.

The bully has incited all the other boys in the class to refer to my son not by his name but by a derogatory term.

We are complaining to the school and there is a formal process.

However, I don't really have much faith the process with absolutely resolve the problem.

I hear that in many cases it is the victim who leaves the school rather than the bully. That is absolutely not going to happen.

So, what should I do to absolutely stop this problem now and forever?

I'm willing to do anything at all within the law and the school rules.

I'm not averse to any harsh measure as long as it's legal - I'm not scared of anyone.
stories.title: Ask HN: My child is being bullied at school, how should I deal with it?
